subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] woohoo perfect signal again
author: Jody Cupp
full_text:

The guy that said perfect signal again at the end of that file. Sounds a wh=
ole lot like one of the techies evp I have from back in November, when I di=
d a session to question if the messages I got on evpmaker with out recordin=
g were real.  He comes off sort of robotic in tone. I'm attaching the evp I=
 got with my little digital voice recorder for comparason. :)

Jody


  ---=
-- Original Message ----- 
  From: Sumption Frank 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroup=
s.com 
  Sent: Wednesday, June 14, 2006 9:23 AM
  Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] wo=
ohoo perfect signal again



   Yeah, I can hear that, but I had to run it =
twice before my ears adjusted to the accent. I think maybe some people that=
 don't hear these aren't allowing their hearing to adjust. Some think it's =
better, or more valid if we don't label the voices, so others aren't biased=
, but I think we need that prompting in the brain to kinda set the ears up,=
 if that makes any sense. 



   Frank




--------------------------------=
----------------------------------------------

  From: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups=
.com [mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of Jody Cupp
  Sent: Tuesda=
y, June 13, 2006 4:35 PM
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
  Subject: [EVP-ITC]=
 woohoo perfect signal again



  Frank,

  your post reminded me of that m=
ethod.  I like to use a broadcast from internet radio.



  Notice the man =
says "you need stop coming in and out like that" Bran was coming in and out=
 of the house while I was recording.  Then the next voice is not even on th=
e broadcast.  he says "perfect signal again" woo hoo!



    ----- Original=
 Message ----- 

    From: Sumption Frank 

    To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com=
 

    Sent: Tuesday, June 13, 2006 5:59 PM

    Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Her=
e's a voice from the 5th.



     This is one voice that was trying to asse=
rt my identity. This was gotten by using a foreign  language as the raw aud=
io in 2002. The foreign language method is tuning in a non English station =
on short wave, I like French, German, and even Chinese. Then I announce I'm=
 doing an EVP recording and record using the built in mic on a cassette dec=
k.  

     Frank
